Athena Chien
Work Publications Design Leadership Resume

Publications

A biologically validated mathematical model for decoding epithelial apical, basolateral, and paracellular electrical properties.

Lewallen, C.F., Chien, A., Maminishkis A., Hirday R., Reichert, D., Sharma, R., Wan, Q., Bharti, K., Forest, C.R.

Includes my work collecting biological results on retinal pigment epithelia at the Bharti lab in the OGVFB division of the National Eye Institute on using electrochemical impedance spectroscopy (EIS) in conjunction with intracellular voltage recording to independently determine permeability changes in apical, basolateral, and paracellular pathways. Also contributed to manuscript writing.

Link

Fabrication and Characterization of I-cord Knitted SMA Actuators

Kim , C., Chien, A. J., Tippur, M., Sung C.

Includes my work from my Summer 2020 internship in the Sung Origami-inspired Robotics Lab on the shape memory alloy, nitinol, wire modeling.

Chondrogenesis of cocultures of mesenchymal stem cells and articular chondrocytes in poly(l-lysine)-loaded hydrogels

Kim, Y. S., Chien, A. J., Guo, J. L., Smith, B. T., Watson, E., Pearce, H. A., Koons, G. L., Navara, A. M., Lam, J., Scott, D. W., Grande-Allen, K. J., & Mikos, A. G.

Includes my work from the Mikos Lab on inclusion of poly-(L-Lysine), chondrotin sulfate content analysis, physicochemical analysis, and degradation studies.

Link

Safety of photosynthetic Synechococcus elongatus for in vivo cyanobacteria-mammalian symbiotic therapeutics

Kim , C., Chien, A. J., Tippur, M., Sung C.

Performed S. elongatus propagation and culture and assisted with writing the manuscript.

Link

Use of a supramolecular polymeric hydrogel as an effective post-operative pericardial adhesion barrier

Stapleton, Lyndsay M., et al.

Designed cover art, not a research contributor.

Link

Chien, A., Lull, E., Forest, C. • Cellular and Tissue Engineering Symposium 2024 Poster Presentation

Chien, A., Lull, E., Forest, C. • BME Department Trainee Seminar, Spring 2024.

Chien, A. • Bioelectromagnetics Graduate Course Guest Lecture, Spring 2024.

Epithelial Electrophysiology and Other Uses of BMED 3110 Knowledge

Optimization of Mammalian Cell Culture Media for In Vitro Photosynthetic Co- culture with Cyanobacteria Synechococcus elongatus

Chien, A. J., Wang, H., Wu, M. W., Hironaka, C. E., Farry, J. M., Williams, K. M., Paulsen, M. J., Stapleton L. M., Steele A. N., Woo, Y. J. • Biomedical Engineering Society 2020 Poster Presentation

Reports results in developing a co-culture media for cardiomyocytes and cyanobacteria from my work from my Summer 2018, 2019 internships in the Woo Lab.

Link

Evaluating In Vitro Cytocompatibility of Encapsulated Mesenchymal Stem Cells in a Chondroitin Sulfate Crosslinked Poly(N-isopropylacrylamide)-Based Hydrogel

Kim, Y. S., Chien, A. J., Guo, J. L., Smith, B. T., Watson, E., Pearce, H. A., Koons, G. L., Mikos A. G. • Rice Undergraduate Research Symposium 2019

Reports results using poly-(L-Lysine) as a therapeutic factor and to increasing hydrogel stability in the Mikos Lab. Won best underclassman engineering poster.
